fields.project_name: Marketing training - agriculture input suppliers, traders - processors
fields.project_activity: Marketing training - agriculture input suppliers, traders - processors

fields.project_description:
Traders, processors and agriculture input-suppliers involved in SAGAL selected value chains will be trained in sales and marketing so they could learn to generate market strategy; training will be in the following topics.

1.	General information about marketing
2.	Basic Marketing
1.	Market segmentation
2.	Market analysis & research
3.	Marketing strategy development
4.	Market linkages
5.	Customers relationship management
6.	Competitors analysis
7.	Product development, demand and supply
The following activities will be undertaken during implementation of the project:
1.	Preparation of PA and BQ.
2.	Selection of training participants.
3.	Coordinate the training idea with the trainer and get their confirmation.
4.	Preparation of training plan and training conducting schedule.
5.	Procurement process.
6.	Conducting the technical training according to the schedule
7.	Providing of training material.
8.	Evaluation of the training.
Prepare training recommendation and completion report.

fields.project_description:
The MCA SAGAL Agriculture team will meet with DAIL staff to discuss its facilitation role in the farmers’ day celebration. SAGAL team would like to support the participation of 120 farmers in the farmer day in order to establish cross linkages between farmers, traders, input suppliers and other relevant stakeholders. 

The following activities will be undertaken during implementation of the project:
1.	Selection of farmer day participants.
2.	Coordinate the activities with the DAIL and get their confirmation.
3.	Preparation of farmer day plan and facilitating the celebration of farmer day according to the schedule.
4.	Evaluation of the farmer day. 
      5.   Prepare recommendation and completion report.
fields.project_name: Supporting Farmers to Participate in DAIL’s Farmer Day
fields.project_activity: Supporting Farmers to Participate in DAIL’s Farmer Day

fields.project_description: SAGAL Urozgan will conduct a 1 day Integrated Pest management training (IPM) for 150 farmers who are members of Uruzgan farmers Association from Tarin kot and Dihrawud districts, the association with coordination of DAIL will introduce the trainees and manage training room at DAI compound. SAGAL will select a qualified trainer who will prepare the training modules according to the need assessment and besides delivering training will conduct the pre and post training evaluation tests. All activities related to finance, procurement and logistics will be properly planned, documented and approved, and the BOQ for this training is annexed to this PA.  This training will cover fundamentals of IPM, introduction to pests and their different kinds, introduction and different kinds of pesticides, quality and labelling of pesticides, chemical, mechanical and biological controls of pests, methods and side effects of using pesticides as well as weed control practices.
fields.project_name: Pre- production IPM training to farmers by DAIL- TOF
fields.project_activity: Pre- production IPM training to farmers by DAIL- TOF

fields.program_objectives:
Objective 2: Increase economic return for high potential licit crop systems
Activity 2.1.1: Value Chain Analysis
fields.effect_or_impact:
What is the anticipated effect or impact of this project?:  (not outputs and not full description) 
1.	The stakeholders in the market system/ value chain will be able to identify gaps in the entire value chains and look for appropriate solutions either through engaging with themselves in small groups or seeking support from relevant other stakeholders.
2.	The stakeholders engaged in the chain will start to find meaning in taking the issues confronting the value chain/market system and form a forum to engage in the longer-term to discuss progress and challenges.
fields.description_of_project_activities:
1-	Identification of the key and influential stakeholders
2-	Conducting the workshop
3-	Presenting the Preliminary Market Map
4-	Summarising the list of problems/gaps in the market system
5-	List the potential solutions as proposed by the stakeholder
6-	Propose formation of the stakeholder forum
fields.justification_description_community_sele: Key and influential stakeholders relevant to the market-chain will be invited to participate in the workshop.
fields.project_name: Participatory Market Mapping Workshop-almond value chain
fields.mc_objectives:
Utilizing private sector development, M4P and community engagement as key tools for programs, Mercy corps will engage with pre and post production farming and agribusiness to achieve higher productivity, higher incomes and sustainable land use for food security.
1.	Key tool: Private sector development, M4P 
2.	Engagement with: Agribusiness
3.	Aimed at: Higher productivity, Higher Incomes
fields.project_activity: Participatory Market Mapping Workshop-almond value chain
fields.capacity: Other
fields.description_of_government_involvement: DAIL will be the key enabling actor who will be a participant in this workshop and will be facilitated to take up the coordination function in the market-system forum.

fields.program_objectives:
Objective 2: Increase economic return for high potential licit crop systems
Activity 2.1.1: Value Chain Analysis
fields.effect_or_impact:
What is the anticipated effect or impact of this project?:  (not outputs and not full description) 
1.	The stakeholders in the market system/ value chain will be able to identify gaps in the entire value chains and look for appropriate solutions either through engaging with themselves in small groups or seeking support from relevant other stakeholders.
2.	The stakeholders engaged in the chain will start to find meaning in taking the issues confronting the value chain/market system and form a forum to engage in the longer-term to discuss progress and challenges.
fields.description_of_project_activities:
1-	Identification of the key and influential stakeholders
2-	Conducting the workshop
3-	Presenting the Preliminary Market Map
4-	Summarising the list of problems/gaps in the market system
5-	List the potential solutions as proposed by the stakeholder
6-	Propose formation of the stakeholder forum
fields.justification_description_community_sele: Key and influential stakeholders relevant to the market-chain will be invited to participate in the workshop.
fields.project_name: Participatory Market Mapping Workshop-Cumin value chain
fields.mc_objectives:
Utilizing private sector development, M4P and community engagement as key tools for programs, Mercy corps will engage with pre and post production farming and agribusiness to achieve higher productivity, higher incomes and sustainable land use for food security.
1.	Key tool: Private sector development, M4P 
2.	Engagement with: Agribusiness
3.	Aimed at: Higher productivity, Higher Incomes
fields.justification_background:
Though various stakeholders in the value-chain engage with each other as per their business need, they have not got together in one platform to understand and discuss the problems faced in the entire market system. As a result, they continue to engage within their limited and specific context in which they operate individually. A market system is closely inter-linked and blockages and issues within it affect every stakeholder and their income potential. There is a need to get the most stakeholders involved to get them to one platform so that they could understand analyse and provide solutions to the problems and gaps.

Preliminary market mapping was conducted by surveying the market stakeholders in the main market value chain, the enabling environment stakeholders and the supporting input/service providers by the project team. The findings of this mapping and the problems and gaps identified by the different stakeholders during the survey will be presented in the workshop.
fields.project_activity: Participatory Market Mapping Workshop-Cumin value chain
fields.capacity: Plans for follow-up made during life of project
fields.description_of_government_involvement: DAIL will be the key enabling actor who will be a participant in this workshop and will be facilitated to take up the coordination function in the market-system forum.

fields.program_objectives: Improve agricultural yields of high potential licit crop system.
fields.effect_or_impact: DAIL extension department will fully understand about SAGAL program’s objectives and activities, strong coordination will be established, DAIL extension department will be able to train farmers on district levels and MCA- SAGAL will facilitate those trainings in SAGAL targeted districts.  Similarly DAIL’s extension, forestry, plant protection and cooperative departments will be able to deliver the services directly to the farmers in our selected Almond and Cumin value chains.
fields.description_of_project_activities:
Strengthening the institutional capacity of DAIL is the key activity based on SAGAL work plan. SAGAL will organize 3days training to DAIL staff in Trinkot and Dehrawod district of Urozgan. This training will include the following 1-	Preparation of training curriculum (Pashto) by Agriculture expert.
2-	Total 3 days training for 10 staff members of DAIL Trinkot and Dehrawod. 
3-	One day training on SAGAL orientation.
4-	Two days technical training in almond and cumin value chains,
5-	M&E of the training will be continued during the training sessions,
6-	Pre and post training evaluation will be conducted using MCA standard evaluation forms,
7-	SAGAL Team will write the final training report
fields.justification_description_community_sele: SAGAL Urozgan team will meet with DAIL Director and discuss about this particular training for DAIL staff and submit a request letter for approval of training and to introduce the target trainees. DAIL Director through an official letter will introduce trainees from provincial as well as from district level sub-departments in our target districts the, Trinkot and Dehrawod. Focus will be given to those DAIL employees who are directly involved in providing extension education services to farmers engaged in our selected value chains.
fields.description_of_community_involvement: Meeting conducted with DAIL, Project proposal for this training with trainee lists submitted to SAGAL program by DAIL
fields.project_name: TOT- SAGAL Orientation and Technical Training - Almond & Cumin - DAIL extension department
fields.mc_objectives:
Utilizing private sector development, M4P and community engagement as key tools for programs, Mercy corps will engage with pre and post production farming and agribusiness to achieve higher productivity, higher incomes and sustainable land use for food security.
1.	Key tool used: Private sector development/M4P/Community engagement
2.	Engagement with: Pre-production/Post-production/Agribusiness
3.	Aimed at: Higher productivity/Higher Incomes/Food Security
fields.justification_background: MCA maintained a strong working relation with DAIL Uruzgan and worked in close coordination since few years. We felt and found the gaps that DAIL’s staff requires training in terms of extension, market linkage, post- harvesting, IPM and new agriculture practices. By this training we aim to upgrade the capacity of DAIL’s staff to build a strong working relation with farmers in the field and deliver the knowledge they learned.
fields.project_activity: TOT- SAGAL Orientation and Technical Training - Almond & Cumin - DAIL extension department
fields.description_of_government_involvement: MCA and MAIL signed an MOU about SAGAL program.

fields.program_objectives: Improve agricultural yields of high potential licit crop system.
fields.effect_or_impact: The input supplier will understand about SAGAL program objectives and activities, strong coordination will be established, bigger input supplier will be able to train smaller input supplier on district levels and MCA- SAGAL will facilitate those trainings in SAGAL targeted areas, smaller input suppliers will be able to link the farmers to themselves and other local and national traders.
fields.description_of_project_activities:
Support input supplier is the key activity based on SAGAL work plan. SAGAL will organize 2days training to input suppliers which includes the following activities; 
1.	Preparation of training curriculum (Pashto) by appointed person.
2.	Fifteen input suppliers will be selected as trainees and a potential one as trainer.   
3.	The trainer will provide two days theoretical and practical training to 15 input suppliers.
4.	All 11 standard forms will be filled by program team from starting up to the end of project.
5.	Monitoring for quality assurance will be continued during the training sessions,
6.	Pre and post training evaluation will be conducted using MCA standard evaluation forms,
7.	SAGAL Team will write the final training report.
fields.justification_description_community_sele: SAGAL Uruzgan team conducted meetings with Agriculture input suppliers of trinkot and Dehrawod districts and discussed about the technical training for input suppliers with focus on those who are directly involved in providing input supply services to smaller input supplier and farmers engaged in our selected value chains. A potential and capable input supplier who agrees to prepare training materials and deliver training to smaller input suppliers will be appointed as trainer whiles a group of 15 others (10 from trinkot and 5 from Dehrawod) will be selected as trainees.
fields.project_name: TOT- Pesticide & Herbicides training - Input suppliers
fields.mc_objectives: Utilizing private sector development, M4P and community engagement as key tools for programs, Mercy Corps will engage with pre and post production farming and agribusiness to achieve higher productivity, higher incomes and sustainable land use for food security.
fields.project_activity: TOT- Pesticide & Herbicides training - Input suppliers
fields.capacity: Other
fields.description_of_government_involvement: An MoU for this training will be signed with relevant Agriculture Input Suppliers

fields.program_objectives: Increase economic return for high potential licit crop systems
fields.effect_or_impact:
1.	The NGAs will propagate the planting material of timber in their nurseries in the project area and are expected to become ‘nursery entrepreneurs’ for timber cuttings and assure availability of timber cuttings in the region. 
2.	Farmers in the region undertake timber cultivation as a remunerative crop option. The farmers have enhanced access to appropriate varieties of timber cuttings from the NGA timber nurseries at a reasonable cost.
fields.description_of_project_activities:
•	Mercy Corps – SAGAL will Select the association members that need to go on the exposure visit and Meet with those eastern region members who are really interested and have good background in this field, visit the Timber cultivation and bring them back with some idea and experience to share it with other Associations members.
•	Listing the resources the visitors will need on the day of the cross visit, and work out who will supply them. For example, the need to take notebook and pens/markers, a camera, and keep visiting relevant people to this visit to a maximum of 6 to 10 people. 
If they don’t read or write, use diagrams and photos. Discuss and agree on the best approach to make sure target audience can attend the exposure visit; 
•	Prepare sheets of paper for visitors to write down what they have learnt what they will take back to their communities and how exposure visits could be improved.
•	Encourage them to develop a plan to undertake the nursery of the timber cuttings. Develop a timeline, resources required, and the size of the nursery that needs to be planted.
fields.justification_description_community_sele:
Planning and running Exposure Visit. It is important to remember that the Cross Visit of Nangarhar, Kunar and Laghman Nursery Growers Association members to learn about the new variety of timber which is cultivated in Gul dara district of Parwan province and create business linkage with those farmers who cultivated timber in their land, market system, find out about the quality agriculture products which are sapling and plants. This activity should be based on bellow criteria. 
•	Selecting the right member of Nursery Grower Association to attend the exposure visit. 
•	Arranging the most appropriate sites for them to visit, 
•	Making sure they are comfortable throughout the exposure visit, 
•	Planning activities at each site to help them learn, understand and remember what they see, 
•	Holding a feedback session on the day to help them to reflect on what they have learnt, and 
Helping them to share information with their own members through a village feedback session.
fields.project_name: Exposure Visit – NGA Members – Timber Cultivation
fields.mc_objectives: Utilizing private sector development, M4P and community engagement as key tools for programs, Mercy corps will engage with pre and post production farming and agribusiness to achieve higher productivity, higher incomes and sustainable land use for food security.
fields.justification_background: The Nursery Grower Associations are already established in the Eastern Region of Nangarhar, Kunar and Laghman Provinces and the farmers have full membership with these Associations and to promoting the private sector development activities in the region and also to organize them properly and encourage them learn new skills. The exposure visits will help the association members to have access to the local plants and sapling market and information, having business linkages with farmers from other provinces, attractions of other stakeholders, business improvement answering the demand of consumers, provide products according to the demand of market and buyers and value adding to the products.
fields.project_activity: Exposure Visit – NGA Members – Timber Cultivation
fields.capacity: Other

fields.program_objectives: Improve agricultural yields of high potential licit crop systems
fields.effect_or_impact:
Mercy Corps/SAGAL is committed, to support the different stakeholders and establish several association for making of good social and work frame for the improvement of agriculture and market system in future. This activity will has the following impacts:
1.	Whenever the associations registered the stakeholders will be able to utilize their own capacity and make a sustainable market system for agriculture products.
2.	The stakeholders will be linked to line sectors and market players, and make these associations self-sustainable.
fields.description_of_project_activities:
As it is stated above registration of associations is vital and foundation without license they will not be permitted to work, deal in the market and ask for the law- full rights of them from government departments. They will be organized and will recognized as strong sources of business and having a good licit income, in light of that Mercy Corps- SAGAL decided to pay a part of association costs. In realty the registration process needs more time and expanses due to government policies and the stakeholders are higher rather than the program. SAGAL will pay legal cost of registration based on providing of documents, and facilitate the registration process of association formation, this activity will consist of the following task/steps:

Facilitating Meeting with People for forming the Association
The activity should be coordinated with line departments. 
Voting for selection of key members and Preparing of necessary documents by assisting program staff.
Presenting of request letter to PGO for getting approvals/ assignment to DoJ for further process.
Fulfilment of all DoJ’s required documents including (Crime Record checking), based on DoJ policy.
The key members will be introduced to MoJ by DoJ with all provided documents, for finalizing the process.
Receiving of the license from MoJ and submitting a copy of license to DoJ
Spreading and propagating of the license copy to all governmental departments by DoJ.
fields.justification_description_community_sele:
MC/SAGAL would like to establish the following associations in Oruzgan Province: 
1.	Oruzgan Farmers Association (OFA): 
the stated association will consist of almost 200 members estimated, and all the members would be selected and introduced by community elders from different districts of Oruzgan province particularly form (Trinkot and Dehrawod districts), the association will be established as provincial level and might be developed in the future. 
2.	Oruzgan Fresh and dry fruit Traders Association: 
This association will consist of almost 30 members estimated who are local traders and real players in the Oruzgan market who buy fruits, cumin and other Ag-Products locally from Orozgan producers/farmers who come from far district of Oruzgan province, and selling to other traders who come from other provinces. the members of the stated association will be selected by Oruzgan Municipality and Key Market Players , this association will be established as provincial level as well and might be developed in the future.
3.	Oruzgan Agriculture Inputs Suppliers Association:
This association will consist of almost 20 members for targeted districts of SAGAL program (Trinkot and Dehrawod) in Oruzgan province. This association also provides inputs to farmers on loan and cash, the members of this association will be selected and introduced by Key Market Players (Key Inputs Suppliers), the association will be established as provincial level and might be developed in the next time.
fields.project_name: Formation and Registration-Association
fields.mc_objectives:
Utilizing private sector development, M4P and community engagement as key tools for programs, Mercy corps will engage with pre and post production farming and agribusiness to achieve higher productivity, higher incomes and sustainable land use for food security.

1.	Key tool: Private sector development, M4P 
2.	Engagement with: Agribusiness
3.	Aimed at: Higher productivity, Higher Incomes
fields.justification_background:
JUSTIFICATION:
Since, the associations are the new sources that farmers and traders are working under an umbrella for development of agriculture and Ag-Products Market, to organize them properly and encourage them for having offices they will need to be supported. This activity will help the market players (producers and buyers) to have access to the market and information, having business linkages with buyers from other provinces, attractions of other stakeholders, coordination with GIRoA departments, business improvement answering the demand of consumers, provide products according to the demand of market and buyers and value adding to the products, and easy participation of beneficiaries in the training and other issue.    
General Background and Problem Statement:
Based on SAGAL work plan and need of stakeholders that there are some gaps in producers’ and traders technical and management capacities. And SAGAL would aim to work with legal sources, increase their capacity in terms of technical, administration, managing information, market information and recoding of data.  Improving business development to establish productive long-term transactional relationships. Perhaps when an association is not licensed and registered them never- receive any notice of meetings. Unregistered association legally will not be involved in any business dealing or catch the market, produce according to the need of consumers and they don’ have any linkage with line market players and they can’t fix the prices for their products individually. The board of association can provide awareness about the prices to the beneficiaries which was not existed yet, Unregistered association is not able to achieve any activities in the region. Although, association is a new idea for market actors in the stated province and they need to be organized and licensed, therefore the current activity will make them able to be organized and registered for improvement of agriculture products market system.
fields.project_activity: Formation and Registration-Association
fields.capacity: Plans for follow-up made during life of project
fields.description_of_government_involvement: Department of Justice (DoJ) and Ministry of Just (MoJ) are the line governmental departments for this activity, at the first stage of registration process the associations need to be registered as provincial level with DoJ, thereafter the key members of new formed association will receive the legal license form ministry of justice.

fields.effect_or_impact:
1.	The farmers will be linked to Ag-Inputs suppliers, for easy, timely, inexpensively and regularly access to Ag-Inputs; in addition the agriculture sector and farm services will be developed and improved indirectly.
2.	The Ag-Inputs Suppliers would be linked to each other; the Ag-Inputs supplement services and business would be expanded and developed.
fields.description_of_project_activities:
Description of Project and Activities:
This project will be consist of the following steps and tasks:

1.	The first meeting with BISA for coordination and arrangement of the Ag-Inputs Exhibition 
2.	Preparing of all the required documents(Financial and Administrative Documents) 
3.	Arrangement and coordination of the participants list with BISA.
4.	Conducting of (Exhibition of Ag-Inputs for the Market Linkage).
5.	Collection of the required documents using in the activity report such as pictures, payments sheets and etc.
6.	Final completion report.
fields.justification_description_community_sele:
26 small retailers, 4 big retailers, 40 farmers and 5 delegates of line departments with total number of 75 will attend the stated exhibition, the Ag-Inputs will be represented at this exhibition by 4 big retailers, and rest of the participants will attend the exhibition as stakeholders and observers.  
Lists for the aforementioned participants will be provided by Inputs Suppliers Association, the provided list will be coordinated with DAIL department by BISA as well.
fields.project_name: Exhibition of Ag-Inputs for the Market Linkage - Input Suppliers
fields.mc_objectives: Utilizing private sector development, M4P and community engagement as key tools for programs, Mercy corps will engage with pre and post production farming and agribusiness to achieve higher productivity, higher incomes and sustainable land use for food security.
fields.name_of_partners: Bost Input Suppliers’ AssociationDistrict wise and Village wise beneficiary list attached
fields.justification_background:
As the farmers need to be linked to Ag-Inputs Suppliers for smooth and easy access to Ag-Inputs therefor SAGAL Helmand team decided to conduct The Ag-Inputs exhibition activity. Through this activity the farmers and small retailers would be able to get access to the Ag-Inputs and services provided by potential wholesalers, the exhibition of Ag-Inputs will provide a platform of understanding the needs of farmers and small retailers and range of services and products available with big input suppliers and their potential to address the market demands. Through this activity the business linkages between center and district level of input suppliers and farmers will be strengthened, and farmer, small retailers and big retailers would be linked each other directly

General Background and Problem Statement
The exhibition of Ag-Inputs will be arranged and facilitated by Bost Input Suppliers Association such as selection place, selection of participants, coordination with DAIL, presentation of banners and getting feedback on impact of the exhibition, and would be financially supported by MCA/SAGAL, Helmand team will keep coordination with Bost Input Suppliers Association and be responsible to prepare all the internal documents.
Currently these input suppliers and farmers have very little access to modern research and technology and a weak coordination exists between small retailers, farmers and potential wholesalers, SAGAL has targeted the Bost input suppliers Association to play role in establishing strong business coordination with small retailers and to expand range of their high quality input supplies to the target beneficiaries,
fields.project_activity: Exhibition of Ag-Inputs for the Market Linkage - Input Suppliers
fields.description_of_government_involvement: DAIL department is an enabling actor at the selected value chains, therefor the (Exhibition of Ag-Inputs for the Market Linkage).) would be coordinated with DAIL by Bost Input Suppliers’ Association, and the planned Ag-Inputs Exhibition would be observed and certified by DAIL department.

fields.program_objectives: Objective 1:  Improve agricultural yields of high potential licit crop systems
fields.effect_or_impact: The business of Input Suppliers will be promoted and improved and they will be able to maintain good business relationship to the relevant market chain actors, this will result in strengthening the market linkages as well as increase in sales and profitability.
fields.description_of_project_activities:
Traders, processors and agriculture input-suppliers involved in SAGAL selected value chains will be trained in sales and marketing so they could learn to generate market strategy; training will be in the following topics.

1.	General information about marketing
2.	Basic Marketing
1.	Market segmentation
2.	Market analysis & research
3.	Marketing strategy development
4.	Market linkages
5.	Customers relationship management
6.	Competitors analysis
7.	Product development, demand and supply
The following activities will be undertaken during implementation of the project:
1.	Preparation of PA and BQ.
2.	Selection of training participants.
3.	Coordinate the training idea with the trainer and get their confirmation.
4.	Preparation of training plan and training conducting schedule.
5.	Procurement process.
6.	Conducting the technical training according to the schedule
7.	Providing of training material.
8.	Evaluation of the training.
Prepare training recommendation and completion report.
fields.justification_description_community_sele:
SAGAL Uruzgan team will conduct meetings with Agriculture input suppliers, traders and processors of Trinkot and Dehrawod districts and will discuss about the marketing training for them. 
	12th grade graduated and experienced trainees will be selected for this training.
	The training will be conducted in the Oruzgan MCA field office.
	Training will be given to the targeted selected agriculture input suppliers and processors
	Participatory learning approach will be practiced during the training.
	Training materials will be designed according to their needs to help in solving their problems.
	Focus will be given on quality of the training and participation of the trainee.
	Holding a feedback session on the day to help them to reflect on what they have learnt
fields.project_name: Marketing training - agriculture input suppliers, traders - processors
fields.mc_objectives: Utilizing private sector development, M4P and community engagement as key tools for programs, Mercy corps will engage with pre and post production farming and agribusiness to achieve higher productivity, higher incomes and sustainable land use for food security.
fields.justification_background:
General Background and Problem Statement:
Supporting the services of agriculture input suppliers and private sector are the key activity based on SAGAL work plan and SAGAL is an agricultural program that promotes income generation and job creation through increased commercial agricultural opportunities for Afghan farmers in poppy-prone areas.  In addition to improving the quality and quantity of products in specific value chains—almond and cumin in Oruzgan —the project also works with DAIL, farmers, processors, associations, input suppliers and other stakeholders to develop sustainable value chains by strengthening connections between agricultural and industrial/commercial intermediaries to enable the development of higher value products for national, regional and international sales.
As most of the businesses in Afghanistan are run with no record, no market system totally lacks in most business which creates lots of problems for both the business owners and investors. Marketing training will enable the businesses to adopt proper business principles and methodologies so that they could maintain proper market of all business activities.
With establishment of efficient sales and marketing management System the business related information or data records can be well organized for analysis or decision making which can ultimately results in higher sales and profitability.
fields.project_activity: Marketing training - agriculture input suppliers, traders - processors
fields.capacity: Plans for follow-up made during life of project
fields.description_of_government_involvement: MOU is signed with Government and is attached

fields.program_objectives: Objective 1:  Improve agricultural yields of high potential licit crop systems
fields.effect_or_impact:
1.	After getting TOT on IPM the Oruzgan Agriculture students and Plant Protectionists will train farmers on IPM focusing on effective usage of agriculture medicine, Improving productivity and quality of vegetables, fruits and other crops to obtain greater incomes, better employment and trade opportunities between market stakeholders
2.	The more farmers get IPM trainings will lead to enhanced access to appropriate varieties of medicines from the Input Suppliers at a reasonable cost.
fields.description_of_project_activities:
Agriculture students and Plant Protectionists will be trained in IPM-TOT so they could expand the knowledge learnt to farmers to educate them in control of pests; training will cover the following topics.

1.	General explaining of IPM
2.	Introduction and kinds of pests
1.	Effective agriculture practices to manage pest control
2.	Strategic controls of pests
3.	Chemical control of pests and
4.	Biological control of pests

The following activities will be undertaken during implementation of the project:
1.	Preparation of PA and BQ.
2.	Selection of trainees.
3.	Coordinate the training idea with the trainer and get their confirmation.
4.	Preparation of training plan and training schedule.
5.	Do necessary procurements. 
6.	Providing of training material.
7.	Conducting the technical training according to the schedule
8.	Pre and Post evaluation of the training.
9.	Prepare training recommendation and completion report.
fields.justification_description_community_sele:
SAGAL Oruzgan team will send official letter to Oruzgan DAIL and university to introduce potential trainees for this TOT in IPM under below criteria, 
	12th grade graduated and experienced trainees will be selected for this training.
	The training will be conducted in the Oruzgan MCA field office.
	Training will be given to the targeted selected Agriculture students and Plant Protectionists 
	Training materials will be designed according to their needs to help in solving their problems.
	Focus will be given on participation of the trainees to ensure high quality of understanding.
	Getting their feedback on the last day to help them to reflect on what they have learnt.

Build capacity of DAIL extension and train farmers through DAIL are the basic activities in SAGAL work plan, SAGAL   Oruzgan team conducted training need assessment of DAIL and farmers, they require various training, after  analyzing and priority MC-Oruzgan selected IPM training which is so essential and effective to conduct for them 
By this training we aim to upgrade the capacity of Agriculture students and Plant Protectionists to build a strong working relation with farmers in the field and deliver the knowledge they learned.

fields.program_objectives: Objective 5: Increased government accountability to citizens, participatory community governance and inclusive planning for rural communities
fields.effect_or_impact:
1.	Building sub-national governance linkages between DDAs and CSOs will enhance their capacity to coordinate well on community issues with relevant governmental institutions and so far contribute in community development on district and provincial level. 
2.	There will be better communication linkages between DDAs and CSOs members as well as they could smoothly coordinate and cooperate with government departments in the future.
3.	The DDAs members will train the CDCs members in the districts and CDCs will deliver the same trainings to the people who are living in their districts.
fields.description_of_project_activities:
•	MCA-SAGAL community mobilization officer will prepare the list of participants who are going to participate in the good governance training of the SAGAL program.
•	Send the invitation letters/meeting to selected trainee to participate in good governance training 
•	Find suitable trainer for good governance training. 
Provide report on the training and make a conclusion of training
fields.justification_description_community_sele:
•	SAGAL representative will meet the individual DDAs & CSOs staffs and they will introduce a person for the training and based on the following criteria the MCA-SAGAL representative will select the participants of the governance training: 
•	The trainee must be from DDA and CSO.
•	The trainee must be having knowledge at least 12 class graduated 
•	The trainee must be having the ability of understanding 
•	The participants of the training are able to transfer the program information to the other members of DDAs, CSOs in their districts.
The participants must be having ability to conduct training for others in districts.
fields.project_name: TOT-Good Governance Training to DDAs & CSos
fields.mc_objectives: Utilizing private sector development, M4P and community engagement as key tools for programs, Mercy corps will engage with pre and post production farming and agribusiness to achieve higher productivity, higher incomes and sustainable land use for food security.
fields.justification_background:
JUSTIFICATION:  
DDAs and CSO members will learn about the good governance system in Afghanistan and how to coordinate and cooperate with governmental institutions. They will understand the responsibilities of people, community based organizations and of government departments or the role of government to the people. The participants of this training will understand importance of good communication and linkages between DDAs, CSOs and other community based associations to deliver the messages to their members,
General Background and Problem Statement:
DDAs and CSOs are the connection points between communities and governmental units, they conveys the needs, troubles and challenges of communities to each of the line departments and struggles for appropriate resolutions. MRRD, donor organizations and some National/ international NGOs have apparently executed extensive trainings to community substructures but the presence of current domestic conflicts and uncertainties indicates that there is still need to contribute in public literacy and awareness in order to bring peace and development, SAGAL Oruzgan team therefore commenced to organize a good governance training for strengthening the capability of DDAs and CSOs. After receiving this training the participants would be able expand the knowledge to members of other relevant institutions to make them able to serve their communities for stable and prosperous nation. The training will help in maintaining strong communications among their members and members of other institutions and will also help in the creation of confidence, trust, reliance environment and establishment of linkages between government, DDA and CSOs.
fields.project_activity: TOT-Good Governance Training to DDAs & CSos
fields.capacity: System of linkage to government department
fields.description_of_government_involvement: MOU is signed with Government and is attached

fields.program_objectives: Objective 1: Improve agriculture yields of high potential licit crop systems
fields.effect_or_impact: DAIL extension department will fully understand about SAGAL program’s objectives and activities, strong coordination will be established. DAIL extension department will be able to train farmers on district levels and MCA- SAGAL will facilitate those trainings in SAGAL targeted districts, DAIL’s extension, forestry, plant protection and coops department will be able to deliver the services directly to the farmers in selected value chains as a result of this enhanced capacity.
fields.description_of_project_activities:
Strengthening the institutional capacity of DAIL is the key activity based on SAGAL work plan. SAGAL will organize a 4 days training to DAIL staff in Lashkar Gah and nearby districts of Nawa-e-Barakzai, Nad-e-Ali and Nahri Siraj. This training will include the following activities; 
1-	Preparation of training curriculum (Pashto) by trainer, 
2-	Total DAIL staff 22X 3 days training.
3-	One day training on SAGAL orientation.
4-	Two days technical training in Watermelon and Grapes value chains,
5-	Total number of days 3 days training,
6-	Preparation of a Plan for extension in the districts,
7-	M&E of the training will be continued during the training sessions,
8-	Pre and post training evaluation will be conducted using MCA standard evaluation forms,
9-	SAGAL Team will write the final training report
fields.justification_description_community_sele: SAGAL Helmand team will meet with DAIL Director and discuss about this particular training for DAIL staff and submit a request letter for approval of training and to introduce the target trainees. DAIL Director through an official letter will introduce trainees from provincial as well as from district level sub-departments in our target districts the, Lashkar Gah, Nawa, Grishk and Nad-e-Ali. Focus will be given to those DAIL employees who are directly involved in providing extension education services to farmers engaged in our selected value chains.
fields.project_name: SAGAL Orientation and Technical Training- Grapes & Watermelon Value Chain-DAIL
fields.mc_objectives: Utilizing private sector development, M4P and community engagement as key tools for programs, Mercy corps will engage with pre and post production farming and agribusiness to achieve higher productivity, higher incomes and sustainable land use for food security.
fields.justification_background:
:  MCA created a strong working relation with DAIL and worked in close coordination since few years. We felt and found the gaps that DAIL’s staff requires training in terms of extension, market linkage, post- harvesting, IPM and new agriculture practices. By this training we aims to upgrade the capacity of DAIL’s staff to build a strong working relation with farmers in the field and deliver the knowledge they learned.
DAIL lacks capacity on the improved practices and technological changes that is happening in the selected value-chains of the SAGAL project.
fields.project_activity: SAGAL Orientation and Technical Training- Grapes & Watermelon Value Chain-DAIL
fields.description_of_government_involvement: Approved letter from DAIL submitted to SAGAL

fields.program_objectives: Objective 5: improve sub- national governance systems.
fields.effect_or_impact: This training is for local governance and socio-cultural institutions (DDAs, CDCs, CSOs & district governor office staff) working in the field of businesses, civil services & human rights and have interest in acquiring more assets to better protect and develop community on district and village levels. At the end of the training the participants will become more familiar with human rights and democracy helping the community-based organizations, government and corporate actors to take action to respect human rights to prevent violence and exploitation among society. After getting this training a close coordination and linkages will be established between DDAs, CDCs, CSOs, and representatives of government
fields.description_of_project_activities:
●	Community Mobilization officer will prepare lists of trainees for human right training 
●	Select professional trainer 
●	Arrange training venues in Tarin kot and Dihrawud 
●	Send invitation letters to trainees 
●	Put PR and order forms for training expenditures
●	Conduct training in Tarin Kot and Dihrawud 
Accomplish all documents and write the final project report.
fields.justification_description_community_sele:
Community mobilization officer will meet with representatives of DDAs, CSOs and government to select potential trainees for this training by having below criteria, 
●	Be members of DDAs, CDCs, CSOs and representatives of Government institutions.
Trainees should have ability of understanding to transfer the information to other members of DDAs, CSOs, CDCs and government.

fields.project_name: Human Rights Training to DDAs, CDCs, CSOs and Government Representatives
fields.mc_objectives: Utilizing private sector development, M4P and community engagement as key tools for programs, Mercy corps will engage with pre and post production farming and agribusiness to achieve higher productivity, higher incomes and sustainable land use for food security.
fields.justification_background:
Decades of wars, domestic conflicts, illicit businesses, insurgencies, poverty, and Illiteracy have caused instability and declining respect for human rights in the country. Human rights violation has always been discussed with serious concerns and international organizations have blamed the Afghan government for failing to establish human rights. People with learning disabilities are vulnerable to human rights violations and thus creating a need for human rights education for both community based organizations and government institutions. SAGAL has therefore included the strengthening of local governance in its main objectives under which we intend to build the capacity of DDAs, CDCs, CSOs and relevant government stakeholders in different disciplines. At the end of the training,
●	The participants of this training will learn about Human Rights and their impact on positive change in attitudes of people and will gain a better understanding about the process, challenges that can be met, but also strategies to overcome these difficulties. 
●	They will understand responsibilities and rights of women, children, youngsters, elders, disable people as well as the role of government institutions. 
The representatives of DDAs, CDCs, CSOs and government will understand how they can strengthen coordination, linkages and trust between people and government to reduce conflicts, violence, exploitation and crimes in society.
fields.project_activity: Human Rights Training to DDAs, CDCs, CSOs and Government Representatives
fields.capacity: Training of project participants to administer/maintain

As Land preparation will effect directly on quality and quantity of products so after this training farmers will gain high quality and more products than before, Though this training farmers will understand about preparation of suitable and fertilized bed for cultivation, removing of weeds from field, designation of plots and irrigation system, treatment of soil with pesticides, soil PH and other tillage practice
fields.project_activity: Pre- Production land preparation training to farmers by association -TOF

fields.description_of_government_involvement:
Description of Government Involvement/Approval
As there is no wide training room in MCA Oruzgan office/ association office so Training venue would be coordinate with line department through Oruzgan Farmers Association, As DAIL department is the line department in such kind of activities and has enabling actor role, therefore they will be responsible to Monitor and verify the implementation of this activity.

fields.program_objectives: Increase economic return for high potential licit crop systems.
fields.effect_or_impact: Due to this project MC SAGAL will support the farmers through DAIL in farmer day which is conducted every year in each province and as a result of this will encourage the farmers regarding their business and production. The celebration of this farmer day is the most important opportunity for linking farmers from center as well as districts to DAIL staff, traders, processors, NGOs and DAIL who are going to exhibit their agriculture tools and raw inputs.
fields.description_of_project_activities:
The MCA SAGAL Agriculture team will meet with DAIL staff to discuss its facilitation role in the farmers’ day celebration. SAGAL team would like to support the participation of 120 farmers in the farmer day in order to establish cross linkages between farmers, traders, input suppliers and other relevant stakeholders. 

The following activities will be undertaken during implementation of the project:
1.	Selection of farmer day participants.
2.	Coordinate the activities with the DAIL and get their confirmation.
3.	Preparation of farmer day plan and facilitating the celebration of farmer day according to the schedule.
4.	Evaluation of the farmer day. 
      5.   Prepare recommendation and completion report.
fields.justification_description_community_sele:
1.	DAIL will select the influential farmers from Tarin Kot and Dihrawud districts.
2.	The farmers will be from SAGAL targeted district in Urozgan.
3.	The farmers will be selected who are involved in SAGAL selected value chains
4.	The selected beneficiaries/farmers must be willing to actively participate in farmers’ day.
5.	Holding a feedback session on the day to help them to reflect on what they have learnt.
fields.project_name: Supporting Farmers to Participate in DAIL’s Farmer Day
fields.mc_objectives: Utilizing private sector development, M4P and community engagement as key tools for programs, Mercy corps will engage with pre and post production farming and agribusiness to achieve higher productivity, higher incomes and sustainable land use for food security.
fields.justification_background:
The National Farmers Day is celebrated on the first day of the first month of each Afghan Calendar year to honour the gracious Farmers and Livestock owners. The event acknowledges the vital position that Farmers and herders occupy in the nation's socio-economic development. This day MAIL/DAIL acknowledges the untiring efforts of farmers and herders at feeding our growing population, providing raw materials to the nation’s industries, and contributing substantially to the nation’s foreign exchange earnings.
During the celebration, exhibition is mounted by institutions and individuals to showcase and share new ideas on technological developments and quality input supplies in the agricultural sector in line with our resolution to apply science and technology to modernize our agricultural landscape to achieve higher productivity and profitability

As a crucial fact of poor coordination between farmers, input suppliers, buyers and of them with other stakeholders, SAGAL will take the opportunity of this platform to support the participation of 120 farmers directly and many more indirectly by cross linkages. We also aim to strengthen the organizational capacity of DAIL by facilitating such events.
fields.project_activity: Supporting Farmers to Participate in DAIL’s Farmer Day
fields.capacity: Plans for follow-up made during life of project
fields.description_of_government_involvement: Approval of supporting farmers day will be made by Formal exchange of letters with DAIL

fields.program_objectives: Improve agricultural yields of high potential licit crop systems
fields.effect_or_impact:
1.	Trained farmers will learn about high quality pesticides, their proper dosage during each spray, suitable timings of pesticide applications and frequencies or number of applications so the percentage of unnecessary usage of pesticides will be reduced. This will save money and lead to high quality produces.
2.	The trained farmers will be able to protect their crops from pests and diseases therefore will produce unimpaired and high quality products.
fields.description_of_project_activities: SAGAL Urozgan will conduct a 1 day Integrated Pest management training (IPM) for 150 farmers who are members of Uruzgan farmers Association from Tarin kot and Dihrawud districts, the association with coordination of DAIL will introduce the trainees and manage training room at DAI compound. SAGAL will select a qualified trainer who will prepare the training modules according to the need assessment and besides delivering training will conduct the pre and post training evaluation tests. All activities related to finance, procurement and logistics will be properly planned, documented and approved, and the BOQ for this training is annexed to this PA.  This training will cover fundamentals of IPM, introduction to pests and their different kinds, introduction and different kinds of pesticides, quality and labelling of pesticides, chemical, mechanical and biological controls of pests, methods and side effects of using pesticides as well as weed control practices.
fields.justification_description_community_sele: Urozgan farmers Association in coordination with DAIL Uruzgan will officially introduce appropriate farmers to IPM training, the trainee farmers must be involved in SAGAL selected value chains either be Cumin farmers or Almond orchard owners.
fields.project_name: Pre- production IPM training to farmers by DAIL- TOF
fields.mc_objectives: Utilizing private sector development, M4P and community engagement as key tools for programs, Mercy corps will engage with pre and post production farming and agribusiness to achieve higher productivity, higher incomes and sustainable land use for food security.
fields.justification_background:
Urozgan province has better climatic condition for agriculture with special reference to horticultural crops, lake of extension education for farmers to understand improved agricultural techniques and disease control strategies have restricted them to produce high quality and quantity of their produces.
SAGAL Urozgan team conducted training need assessment of farmers and found that they require various types of trainings so after analyzing the team prioritized the IPM training which will help farmers in identification of disease problems and timely possible solutions.
fields.project_activity: Pre- production IPM training to farmers by DAIL- TOF
fields.capacity: Provision of Written Guidance
fields.description_of_government_involvement: MOU is signed with Government and is attached
